Backup/Co-Mod: WhyMafia




End Game

Rules


The Basics:

1] Play to win. Nobody wants to be a loser.
2] Do not take screenshots or directly quote any of the PMs that I send you. Doing so will result in a mod-kill. Pretending to break this rule is the same as actually breaking it. You may paraphrase, but use caution. When in doubt, run it by me first.
3] Do not edit any of your posts, if you have the ability to do so.
4] Do not use encrypted text, hidden text, small text, or any other hard-to-read text when posting.
5] Once you have been lynched or killed, you are out of the game. Do not post anymore until the game is over. "Bah" post if you need to, but eh...
6] Do not talk about this game with anybody else outside of this thread unless your role PM explicitly says that you can.
7] Heated discussion is fine, but personal attacks, insults, flaming, and poor sportsmanship are not. Please don't be a jerk to your fellow players. If I feel that your behavior is preventing other players from enjoying the game, I reserve the right to force-replace or mod-kill you.
8] Do not talk about ongoing games. Like really, come on...

Day, Night, and Twilight:

9] Each Day phase will last for two weeks apiece and each Night phase will last for two days. Once there are less than eight people, each day phase will become only ten days long. I will post specific deadlines in the game thread at the start of every Day and Night phase.
10] Players may continue to talk during Twilight, including the player that has been lynched.
11] If you do not send me your Night action before the specified deadline, I will assume that you are not performing an action on that night, unless your role specifically requires an action, in which case a randomizer will be used to complete the action.
12] If you know you will be unavailable during a Night phase, you may send me your night action during the preceding Day phase if you so desire.
13] Deadline extension requests will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

Voting:

14] Please post all votes and unvotes using either the bold tag or the vote tag. Nicknames are fine, as long as I can understand them. Votes should look like this:
Vote:Boonskiies
or VOTE: Boon.
15] Unvotes are helpful, but not necessary.
16] Please refrain from engaging in any kind of voting trickery. If it looks like a vote, I'm counting it as a vote.
17] A lynch will only occur when a majority (more than 50% of all possible votes) is reached. The number of votes needed to hammer will be included with every vote count.
18] If a majority is not reached by the deadline, there will be no lynch on that Day.
19] Once a hammer occurs, no votes or unvotes will prevent the lynch from happening.
20] Additional votes include VOTE: No Lynch to end the Day with no lynch (which will also require a majority) and VOTE: Draw to end the game in a draw (which will require 100% agreement from all living players).

Activity:

21] You will be expected to post at least once every 48 hours. If you go more than 48 hours without posting, you will be prodded.
22] If you receive a prod, you will have 24 hours to post in the game thread. If you do not respond to your prod within 24 hours, you will be replaced. Additionally, if I have to prod you more than three times, you will be replaced.
23] If you know that you will have limited access to the game for more than a few days, please let me know either in the thread or via PM.

Communication with the Moderator:

24] I may be pretty close to perfect, but I do still make mistakes every now and then. If you notice an error with the vote counts, deadlines, or anything else related to the game, please let me know and I will correct the issue.
25] I will not answer any role-related questions in the game thread. If you have any questions about your role, the (theoretical) roles of any other players in the game, or (theoretical) role interactions, send me a PM. Do not try to trick me into confirming a player's role. I will not be amused.
26] If you need to get my attention, just include @Mod or @Boon in your post. Also, bolding will help catch my eye.

Miscellaneous:

27] Scum teams may or may not have day talk. I choose to keep this hidden.
28] If you have any problems with another player, send me a PM and I will do my best to resolve the issue.
29] If a player is mod-killed during the Day phase, then that Day will end immediately.
30] My color is Purple (#800080) DON’T USE IT.

31] The flavor text is for entertainment purposes only. Analyze it at your own risk.
32] Do not ask me to mod-kill, force-replace, or discipline any other player in the game. That is my decision to make, not yours.
33] As the moderator, my word is final. Please respect my instructions and my decisions. If I am not around, my back up mod should be treated just as I would be.
34] I reserve the right to change these rules during the game if necessary. If this happens, I will inform everybody of the rule change in the thread.
35] In addition to these rules, all site-wide rules also apply.
36] Claiming color code, timestamps, spelling, or any other form of non-public information is prohibited.
37] If the game happens to have multiple scum factions, I will play the game out through. If only scum remain, and all scum end up dying on the final night, the game will be a joint win between scum factions.
38] Go ahead. Find a loophole in my rules. Abuse of a loophole may end with a mod-kill.
39] I live in California, and have Pacific Standard Time.
39] You may notice that this is a second Rule 39. I am the mod. I have the right to do this because in the end, what I say goes.


Sample Vanilla Townie:

40] At least one person will receive this PM.

Welcome, [insert player name here], you are a
Vanilla Townie
.

Abilities:

• During the day, you can vote and talk
• You do nothing special.

Win condition:

You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated and there is at least one town player alive.

Game thread is here. Confirm by replying to this PM with your role name.


BooneyToonz Series Disclaimer:

Spoiler:
The BooneyToonz series was created by me to play with unique and interesting roles specifically in Normal games. My goal with all BooneyToonz games is to create unique normal setups with potentially new and unheard of variant roles or an innovative concept without overstepping the boundary of normal game limits or mechanics. Any role that is created will be completely thought out and balanced in a way that I feel fits into what are normal game limitations, along with the idea of what a normal game should be. Don't get the wrong idea; this series is NOT about making a game with a bunch of strong power roles or a role madness game within a normal game. There may very well be as little as one power role, or even none at all. All this being said, I will always have this disclaimer for every game in my BooneyToonz series.

Role PM's will be sent out shortly. Game will start when 11/13 people have confirmed. Confirmed players will be bolded in the player list. Unconfirmed players will have 48 hours to confirm or will be prodded. Regardless, the game will start in 24 hours, or 12pm PST, 6/28/17.

Confirm by responding to your role PM. If anyone has any questions, feel free to PM me.



*Role PM's have been sent out!!!

13/13 players have confirmed!


GAME HAS BEGUN!!!!



Fun player list. I knew all of you guys prior to this game except for maybe two of you.

Don't recall saying anything for or against that tactic in the past, before my hiatus. Post-hiatus, i've not dealt with that situation. But in general, as i understand the game theory behind it- there's only two situations where a selfhammer is beneficial: selfhammering as town to set up a 1-1-1 endgame between town/scum/sk(or second scum), or 3 minutes before the deadline expires on the day to ensure a flip and at least some information. That's as town. Selfhammering as town in any other case is pushing for the mislynch of a town player, which always is harmful to the town win condition. As scum- you are in a small team- if you selfhammer, you automatically cripple your team (even worse if what Mulch claimed was truthful, he claimed that he was a scum roleblocker), The idea of "denying town discussion time" is complete and utter bullshit here, because you're handing a scum lynch to the town on a silver platter, instead of kicking and screaming all the way to the noose. It is entirely possible a flashwagon forms, or deflecting lynch on to someone who made a scummy vote(like me or taco), hoping for deadline to hit causing no-lynch, or, in this particular case, mulch could have faked a townslip post-fake-taco-hammer that could have reasonably convinced him of mulchscum's towniness. Instead "oh you caught me" then bunches of wifom. What is more pro-scum? Fighting the lynch, clearly. Anyone who espouses the benefits of selfhammering as scum is clearly wrong. Hence, cardinal sin as scum to selfhammer.

A Jailkeeper that simultaneously blocks and protects their target is considered Normal on mafiascum.net, provided that any mutual blocking scenarios are planned for during review. Any role that receives results (such as Tracker or Watcher) but is blocked as a result of being targeted by a Jailkeeper should receive a "no result" message, rather than told their target didn't go anywhere or nobody visited their target. A Jailkeeper cannot stop a Strongman from committing a kill (regardless of who they target), and does not prevent other players from targeting their target with non-killing actions (e.g. if a Watcher and Jailkeeper target the same player, the Watcher will see the Jailkeeper's action).

Three times you've had something similar to the odd night cop, even night GS mechanic:

1707:
Jailkepeer, Ascetic odd night cop, even night gs, backup rolecop (troll role)
vs goon, goon, encryptor

1861:
Jailkeeper, Odd night cop, even night cop
vs role cop, goon, goon

1919:
odd night cop, gunsmith, vig
vs odd night roleblocker, goon, goon

Here:
jailkeeper, odd night cop, even night gunsmith, heavily nerfed bodyguard (can't swap targets, and asceticizes the pair if he picks wrong)
vs half a godfather, encryptor, vanilla cop (useful to find those PRs you need to kill)

In terms of mini normal balance, that's pretty much fine. I might question a bit whether odd and even cop + jailkeeper settings are just generally OP for town compared to how they get balanced, but it is in no way is MORE townsided than similar setups that have been approved in the past. "Cop can claim d1 without consequence" isn't entirely true, and it's even more true that the jailkeeper is pretty hosed if he claims d1 since only the symbiotic can save him.

Cop is also nerfed by being loyal (a roleblocker is obviously possible, even if there wasn't one in this setup), and gunsmith is HEAVILY nerfed by having a scum role that is a godfather to it. And, of course, both of those roles are nerfed by the possibility that symbiotic will choose wrong and attach to scum (and even there, you simply get MORE roles that look like there could be a roleblocker action going on). I think that this setup is fine for MS balance, and would probably approve it again. MS balance is such that towns NEED a lot of power to be competitive. Sometimes that results in town stomps, but bulk majority of the time it simply doesn't.

This really expands my criticism, rather than refuting it. But ok?

Looking at night actions, scum got hosed by there being a n1 fake guilty on scum.  If that happens on town (always the likelier outcome ESPECIALLY given that loyal cop is fundamentally incentivized to try and find town), how much different is the game?

In post 3308, Maestro wrote:
In post 3307, mhsmith0 wrote:Similar-looking setups that have been approved
This really expands my criticism, rather than refuting it. But ok?
Ultimately, scum have a >50% win rate in 10/3 mini normals (IIRC it's close to 60% actually). So in terms of balance, overall mini normals aren't especially townsided, they're just "townsided" compared to what players THINK should be balanced. A fair question is if this particular set of powers (jailkeeper plus odd/even cop/gs) is more powerful than given credit for (which may be a fair discussion to happen), but in general people just think things are townsided when they aren't. It's EXTREMELY common for me to review a mini normal where the following two things BOTH happen

1) People complain setup is townsided
2) Scum win with 2 or 3 of their team alive

So I tend to take balance complaints with a LOT of salt.
I would definitely not have had Vecna's insights, so I'm glad he replaced me.

This was my first time modding a mini and a large at the same time, and damn...it was a lot to keep up with.

Because of this, I have gotten all my posts and whatnot ready to copy/past and fill in blanks from whenever I need to go on a document on my phone, so I will be able to do everything from my phone next time.

BooneyToonz V will be run very smoothly because of this, as I have some over the top roles that I want to see take place, but I could never get them approved in a normal (nor do I think they should be).

I have at least 6 more created setups that I've been working on, as setup design is kind of my favorite part of mafia. Not all of them would be in my BooneyToonz series, though, as some are theme games. I've actually created a 3-5 player variant of mafia (technically isn't mafia, but takes all the mechanics from mafia), and I think I just perfected my 16 player variant for it. It's a semi-open setup, which is different for me.

I like to give a clear theme in the game that makes the game more memorable yet doesn't actually add anything, which is why I really enjoyed the simplicity of the Virus thing. (If I was allowed to, the mafia would have been called the Virus Mafia this game), as it adds a nice touch, I feel. Along with making every day somewhat more memorable in a simple way, like here with the different colors for each day.

But yeah, I'll keep a list of the people who say they enjoy my games/pre-in, and message you when my games are coming up. Thanks everyone! I had a blast watching you all play!
